update.description:
Reads the `tension` parameter from [this SDF PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/466/tension/diff), and passes it along to ignition math.

The tension parameter allows the user to control how strictly the animation should follow the set of waypoints.

You can see the difference by running `tension.world`: gazebo worlds/tension.world
update.title: Use tension trajectory parameter

content.raw: I think we actually don't need an SDF6 release to merge this, since there's no test. I'm ok with just merging it now, feel free to merge if you agree, @scpeters / @nkoenig .
content.html: I think we actually don't need an SDF6 release to merge this, since there's no test. I'm ok with just merging it now, feel free to merge if you agree, @scpeters / @nkoenig .

content.raw: I think this world could be renamed to `animation_tension.world` to be more specific.

content.raw: I think API is ok, since this adds a default value for the new parameter, but ABI definitely has problems
content.html: I think API is ok, since this adds a default value for the new parameter, but ABI definitely has problems

content.raw: As @scpeters pointed out, this breaks API / ABI, so the PR needs to be refactored or retargeted.
content.html: As @scpeters pointed out, this breaks API / ABI, so the PR needs to be refactored or retargeted.
